definitions: A push or pull on an object
Something that can make objects move, stop, or change direction

The ability to do work or cause change

Force multiplied by the distance moved in the force's direction

Work divided by time, measured in watts

Movement of an object

The rate of change in speed

Mass multiplied by gravitational force
The force that pulls objects toward each other

The natural force of attraction between masses
A force that opposes motion between two touching surfaces

Resistance when one surface rubs against another

Force divided by the area it acts on

Mass per unit volume of a material
How heavy something is for its size

Components connected so electricity can move

Invisible force field around magnets
